name: Hollywood Bed & Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my husband stayed at the Hollywood B&B for 5 nights during our honeymoon. The rooms were very comfortable, a really good size with fantastic decor!
reviews.title: Great decor and excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Breakfast was perfect, great selection of bagels, yogurt, ceral orange juice etc.
reviews.title: Great B&B, shame we had to share it with ants!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the comet room. We didnt keep any food in the room as we had read about the ants on here, we still found a few but nothing too drastic. I was also a little uncomfortable that the small window in the shower wasnt frosted glass however i dont think you could see in from downstairs. Other than that the food was great with a view of the pool.
reviews.title: Wonderful location, outstanding b´n´b

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011
reviews.text: The location of the hotel was briliant, although we had a car we did walk from there to the walk of fame and the sunset strip.
reviews.title: This was the best start we could have had for our trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definately recommend this B&B if you are looking for somewhere comfortable and a little bit different!
reviews.title: A quirky gem in Hollywood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is the place to stay in Hollywood, if you like a one-off, relaxed place to stay in an excellent location in Hollywood. The house and gardens are filled with unusual hippy-style artifacts, and the rooms are all hand-painted by one of the owners. During our stay it was spotlessly clean and tidy; the breakfast was generous and excellent quality, and the pool a delight to use. If you want the Marriott, Best Western or Holiday Inn experience, go there! But this was definitely infinitely better for us. The owners are very welcoming, relaxed and helpful, and we liked the classical music in the kitchen/breakfast room. And there are two pianos and a guitar, among other instruments, for you to play if so inclined. It is excellent value, and would be hard to beat.
reviews.title: Quirky, interesting, excellent value, family-run bed and breakfast in excellent location in Hollywood.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed with Nina and William over the Academy Awards weekend. What a treat! The Kodak Theater was an easy walk, and yet we were in a quiet neighborhood. Although the pool was tempting, the weather wasn't. Hollywood Bed & Breakfast is a wonderful oasis from the crowds, traffic and madness of the LA area. We enjoyed the eclectic decor and the welcome touches throughout. Our room was cozy, comfortable and clean. This is a touch of Bali-wood in the heart of Hollywood!!
reviews.title: Bali-wood ... a perfect stop with the comforts of home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed 3 nights and loved it. The interior and exterior are colorful, playfull, and really made the stay very special. Our host William was easygoing but extremely helpful. We took a ton of pictures of the house (it's gorgeous). We would stay here again for certain.
reviews.title: Enchanting Bed and Breakfast in the heart of Tinseltown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I lived in Los Angeles for four months while I worked with a photographer in Beverly Hills. I stayed with a friend during the first two months and when my family came to visit one weekend they stayed at Hollywood Bed & Breakfast. When they were here I got to see the place and was stunned at its uniqueness and exotic atmosphere. I spent most of the weekend with my family at the bed and breakfast although my apartment was just a block down the street.
reviews.title: The best place to stay in Los Angeles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To make a long story short, I loved the place so much I decided to move into the bed and breakfast and spend my last two months in Hollywood sampling all of their rooms. It was the most wonderful place to stay. The rooms were spacious and just as lavish as the rest of the house. The house was always clean and the rooms made fresh every day. The selection for breakfast was always wonderful, I loved the granola and choices of cereal, and of course the always-full bowl of bananas.
reviews.title: Good base to explore a vast LA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We didn`t find Hollywood Bed and Breakfast to be quite the wonderful experience most other reviewers seem to think it is. Having said that it is very good and has to be seen to be believed. Bright, funky and very comfortable I can recommend it. Breakfast was good too. Location`s not bad although the walk to the main Hollywood strip is not a short one; don`t be led to believe otherwise. We took away with us only one real negative: for a number of reasons, staying here very much feels as if you`re staying in someone else`s home. If you`re OK with that then you`ll find this place perfect.
reviews.title: Good, but not brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We took over the entire Hollywood B&B for our reunion. It was absolutely wonderful. The decor set the tone for the entire 3 days. We could all sit around the dining room table together for breakfast and dinner and talk, talk, talk. The rooms and baths were lovely. Each is an original. We loved checking out each room. We sat outdoors around the pool and curled up each evening in the spacious living room to talk away the evenings. William and Nina have thought of everything to made our stay perfect. The breakfast coffee was always ready and a good choice of toast, bagels, etc, plus all varieties of cereals. It could not have been better.
reviews.title: Our reunion was terrific

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This place was a pleasant surprise. Colorful, quirky and very different from anythng else than you see in LA. The service was great and Nina was very helpful. Location was ok and bascially just around the corner from the Laugh Factory. Funny thing,...Kanye West party house was pointed out on the map Nina gave me :-)
reviews.title: A must when visting LA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was maybe the best ever had. I had to take a couple of slices of cinnamon raisin ekstra when I left..
reviews.title: Superb location, funny decor, mini parking lot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Thanks for a very nice stay.
reviews.title: Quirky and great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hollywood Bed & Breakfast was the first accommodation on our US trip and wow...what a start!
reviews.title: Fantastic stay at Hollywood Bed & Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nina and William were wonderful hosts and made us feel so welcome when we arrived. We arrived well before check in however we were able to leave our bags, and they provided us with a key and the time our room would be ready (which was before the normal check-in, greatly appreciated after our long flight). The room was beautiful and the bed was so comfortable. Everything was extremely clean and the bathroom was excellent. The house is quirky but we loved it, and we really felt at home there. The continental breakfast was great, with a huge selection. Nina and William put so much effort into every aspect of your stay. Unfortunately we didn't get a chance to try the pool, but it did look very inviting.
reviews.title: So relaxing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Access to LA was easy with convenient public transport, and the Chinese theatre was a 10 minute walk from the B&B.
reviews.title: Awesome start to our holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a stress free stay in a good location we thoroughly recommend Hollywood B&B.
reviews.title: A Fantastic Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just stayed at the holly wood b n b and it is fantastic!!! Great comfy beds very clean and funky and right near the heart of Hollywood. Would stay again any day.
reviews.title: Fantastic

description: You are invited to enjoy Hollywood by staying at our whimsical 1912 Bed & Breakfast located right on Hollywood Boulevard and within walking distance of the Sunset Strip and the Hollywood Walk of Fame, Grauman's Chinese Theater, Hollywood&Highland Theatre, site of the Academy Awards and home of Cirque du Soleil's IRIS and Madame Tussaud's Wax Museum. The proprietors, Nina (who speaks German, French and Spanish) and William are very well acquainted with Hollywood and Southern California.
